content.text:
# Twentieth Century Communism

Twentieth Century Communism is a biannual peer-reviewed academic journal covering research on the Russian Revolution (1917–1991), the activities of communist parties, antecedents, rivals (including political groups and nation states), and cultural and political influences. Its editors-in-chief are Kasper Braskén (University of Helsinki) and Margarite Poulos (Western Sydney University). The journal was established in 2009 and is published by Lawrence & Wishart.
See also
*American Communist History
*Communisme
